content.rendered:
What is a Legal Secretary?

Legal Secretaries assist Lawyers in the preparation and filing of legal documents.

Where do Legal Secretaries work?

  • Law offices
  • Government agencies
  • Public interest firms

How much does a Legal Secretary make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Legal Secretaries is $38,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Legal Secretaries?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Political science majors
  • Psychology majors
  • Business majors
  • English majors
Search jobs on Handshake

Legal Secretaries skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Legal Secretaries succeed in their work:

  • Highly organized
  • Ability to multitask
  • Solid understanding of legal jargon

What are some common questions about Legal Secretaries?

Q: Do Legal Secretaries need a degree?

A: Many employers require that their Legal Secretaries have at least an Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree.
